subject: Education
title: John Dewey: Learning by Doing
description: A fast breakdown of John Dewey: Learning by Doing for builders.

hook.text: Dewey opened a school where students ran a farm, a kitchen, and a workshop.

buildup.text: He believed children learn best through experience, not through sitting and listening.

discovery.text: His Lab School at the University of Chicago proved hands-on projects build real understanding.

twist.text: Critics called it chaos. Dewey called it democracy in action.

climax.text: Dewey's philosophy shaped progressive education worldwide for the next century.
